alert.note: Alert for Jackson; White (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 07 at 1:02PM CDT until June 07 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern White County in central Arkansas... Southwestern Jackson County in eastern Arkansas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 102 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing heavy to excessive rain across the warned area. The radar estimated one to two inches of rain. Given additional heavy rain, flash flooding is likely to occur. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Steprock, Denmark, Velvet Ridge, Heffington, Sunnydale, Hickory Flat, Dewey and Possum Grape. This includes the following streams and drainages... Onion Creek, Oats Creek, Butter Creek, Little Red River, Piney Creek, Fourteenmile Creek, Bullock Branch, Fourmile Creek, Coon Creek, Brier Creek, Holcomb Branch, Bailey Creek, Big Creek, Tenmile Creek, Potter Branch, Blue Creek, Hickman Branch, Departee Creek, Glaise Creek, Hopspinike Slough, Stevens Creek, Sugar Creek, Pumpkin Branch and Hurricane Branch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
